## 2023 Stock Status {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="45%"}
### Stock is Healthy

- **SB/SBF=0 = 0.35** (0.30-0.40)
  - Above limit reference point
  
- **F/FMSY = 0.59** (0.46-0.74)
  - Below target
  
- **Status**: NOT overfished, NOT overfishing

<br>

### But Model is Unstable

- **54-model grid** shows:
  - Wide uncertainty ranges
  - Variable recruitment estimates
  - Inconsistent biomass trends
  
- **SC19**: "instability appears to remain"

## 2023 Assessment: Model Improvements {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### Major Changes from 2020

**Catch-conditioned model** [@day2023bet]:
- Reduced from 11,421 to 3,067 parameters
- More stable convergence

**sdmTMB CPUE standardization** [@hamer2023cpue]:
- Spatial-temporal modeling framework
- Replaced VAST approach

**Lorenzen natural mortality** [@lorenzen1996]:
- Size/age-dependent M scaling
- More realistic mortality patterns

**Internal growth estimation** [@farley2020growth]:
- Von Bertalanffy parameters estimated
- 1,004 otoliths incorporated
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Independent Review Integration

**Punt et al. (2023)** [@punt2023review]:
- Reviewed 2020 YFT assessment
- **SC19 decision**: Apply to BET where practical

**Key recommendations implemented**:
- Revised tagger effects modeling [@peatman2023tagger]
- Tag mixing period as grid axis
- Size composition reweighting methods
- Growth-M correlation handling

### Rigorous Convergence Process

**Extensive jittering** [@day2023bet]:
- Up to 60 runs per model to find global optimum
- Diagnostic model achieved positive definite Hessian
- 48 of 54 grid models converged
:::
:::

:::

## 2023 Assessment: Results & Uncertainty {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### Stock Status (2021)

**SB/SB~F=0~ = 34%** [@day2023bet]:
- Just below LRP (40%)
- Median across 54-model grid

**Fishing mortality above F~MSY~**:
- Overfishing occurring
- Primarily from purse seine associated sets

**Recruitment stable** since 1960:
- ~120 million fish/year
- No evidence of recruitment impairment

### Data Inputs

**Time series**: 1952-2021 (70 years)

**Size compositions**: 41 fisheries

**Tagging**: ~67K BET (RTTP, PTTP, JPTP)

**CPUE**: Longline indices (9 regions)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Structural Uncertainty Grid

**54 models** exploring [@day2023bet]:
- **Tag mixing**: 1Q, 2Q, 3Q (most influential)
- **Steepness**: 0.65, 0.80, 0.95
- **Size comp weighting**: 3 methods
- **Age data weighting**: 6 levels

### Remaining Challenges

**High parameter uncertainty**:
- Correlations between M, growth, recruitment
- Sensitivity to starting values

**Key data limitations**:
1. Limited age data (1,004 otoliths)
2. Spatial structure complexity (9 regions)
3. Size composition conflicts with tagging
4. Tag mixing period uncertain

**SC19 Evaluation** [@sc19outcomes]:

"More rigorous... but **model instability remains**"

**Result**: **14 research recommendations**
:::
:::

:::

## Issue #1: Age Data Quality {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="52%"}
### Problem

- **Only 1,004 otoliths** aged — insufficient for internal growth estimation
- High parameter uncertainty, affects biomass scaling
- Limited spatial coverage

### Impact

- Cannot reliably estimate von Bertalanffy parameters
- Growth-M correlation issues

### SC19-#1, #7, #10

Continue age data collection; evaluate growth/mortality variability; explore regional traits

:::

::: {.column width="48%"}
![Sampling locations of fish aged [@day2023bet]](figures/prepaw/bet2023-fig-016.png){width=100%}
:::
:::

:::

## Issue #2: Spatial Structure {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="52%"}
### 9-Region Problems

- 41 fisheries, 3,067 parameters, ~24-hour runtime
- Persistent convergence issues (Hessian, correlations)
- Model sensitivity to starting values (Parameter identifiability issues)

### Evidence Supporting 6-Region

**Biological data** [@hamer2023spatial]:
- Low tropical <-> temperate movement
- High mixing within tropical/temperate zones
- Size composition clustering supports simpler structure

**Model performance**:
- 6-region used 2005-2011 successfully
- Faster runtime, fewer parameters
- Better convergence stability

### SC19-#4

Simulation study: 6-region vs 9-region performance; "areas-as-fleets" approach
:::

::: {.column width="48%"}
![Proposed 6-region [@hamer2023spatial]](figures/prepaw/spatial-fig-004.png){width=100%}

:::
:::

:::

## Issue #3: Indonesia Handline Data {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="52%"}
### Problem

**2024 catch spike**: Large increase in handline catch — major uncertainty in historical allocation

### Data Quality

- BET/YFT difficult to distinguish; no clear criteria
- Port sampling only (<5%); no observers; no logbooks
- Catches aggregated evenly across time/space

### Impact

- Major uncertainty in catch allocation
- Large tropical biomass uncertainty
- Size composition conflicts

## Issue #5: Size Composition Weighting {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="52%"}
### Problem

**No iterative reweighting in 2023**:
- Fixed weights (no iterative weighting due to time constraints)
- Data conflicts unresolved

### Data Conflicts

- **Weight comp vs length/tagging** pull opposite directions [@day2023bet]
- **"Inversion"**: Weight -> higher biomass; length/tags -> lower biomass

### Potential Causes

- Unrepresentative sampling, coverage gaps
- Selectivity/growth misspecification
- Sampling observational errors or some conversion method issues

### Impact

- Biomass scale and reference point uncertainty

### SC19-#11, #12

Review representativeness; investigate inversion
:::

::: {.column width="48%"}
![Likelihood profile [@day2023bet]](figures/prepaw/bet2023-fig-013.png){width=100%}
:::
:::

:::

## Issue #7: Model Convergence {data-background-image="static/spc-slide-sidebar.png" data-background-size="5% 100%" data-background-position="left"}

::: {style="margin-left: 1.5%; margin-right: 1.5%; font-size: 0.62em; line-height: 1.3;"}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="48%"}
### Problem & Results

**Sensitivity to initial conditions** — Models achieve suboptimal local minima

**Diagnostic model**:
- Primary jittering (60x): Improvements of **tens to hundreds** of likelihood units
- Stock status shifts: **5%+ in SB/SB~F=0~**

**Grid models**:
- Before: 46/54 with PDH → After: **48/54 with PDH**
- **Every model improved** through jittering

**SC19-#9, #13**: Identify correlated/sensitive parameters; strategies to decrease starting value sensitivity
:::

::: {.column width="52%"}
### Key Findings [@day2023bet]

::: {style="background-color: #fff5f5; padding: 0.7em; border-left: 4px solid #d32f2f; margin-bottom: 0.8em;"}
> "**Model convergence is a significant issue** for these complex models... **jittering is an important process** to refine and improve the best solution."
:::

::: {style="background-color: #fff5f5; padding: 0.7em; border-left: 4px solid #d32f2f; margin-bottom: 0.8em;"}
> "Jittered solutions achieved **improved objective function values** and **notable changes to derived management quantities**. This was cause for **considerable concern**."
:::

::: {style="background-color: #fff5f5; padding: 0.7em; border-left: 4px solid #d32f2f;"}
> "**Every grid model** improved through jittering — **none was at a global minimum**, even those 46 with positive definite Hessians."
:::
:::
:::

:::

### Convergence Strategy

**SC19-#9** [@sc19outcomes]: Identify problem parameters
- Profile correlated parameters
- Test parameter fixing options
- Reduce dimensionality where possible

**SC19-#13** [@sc19outcomes]: Improve stability
- Multiple starting values (jittering) [@day2023bet]
- Phased parameter estimation
- Hessian diagnostics at each step

### Simplification Options

**Consider reducing complexity** [@punt2023review]:
- Spatial structure (6R vs 9R) [@hamer2023spatial]
- Fishery aggregations
- Selectivity parameterization

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Enhanced Diagnostics

**Retrospective analysis** [@punt2023review]:
- Peel test (5-10 years)
- Mohns rho calculation
- Pattern identification

**Tag diagnostics** (**SC19-#14**) [@sc19outcomes; @peatman2023tagger]:
- Likelihood profile analysis
- Tagger effects evaluation
- Mixing period validation

**Residual analysis** [@day2023bet]:
- Size composition fits
- CPUE index fits
- Tag recovery patterns
- Identify systematic patterns

### Robustness Testing

**Extensive testing** [@day2023bet]:
- Self-consistency checks for a diagnostic model (possibly including a few key grid models depending on model run time)
- Jittering to ensure global optimum

### Fully Open & Reproducible

**All code and data publicly available**:

- **Analysis code**: [github.com/PacificCommunity/ofp-sam-2026-BET](https://github.com/PacificCommunity/ofp-sam-2026-BET)
  - MFCL model runs
  - R/FLR4MFCL processing
  - Diagnostic plots

- **Report compilation**: [github.com/PacificCommunity/ofp-sam-2026-BET-report](https://github.com/PacificCommunity/ofp-sam-2026-BET-report)
  - Quarto source files
  - This presentation
  - Full documentation

### Containerized Environment

**Docker image** for reproducibility:

- Pre-built R environment with all dependencies
- Ensures identical results across platforms
- Available at: [ghcr.io/pacificcommunity/bet-2026](https://github.com/PacificCommunity/ofp-sam-2026-BET/pkgs/container/bet-2026)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Automated Workflows

**GitHub Actions** for quality control and continuous integration:

- **Automatic report compilation**
  - Every update on writing triggers rebuild, including figures
  - Ensures report stays synchronized with analysis

- **Code testing**
  - Diagnostic model (with a single iteration in MFCL) runs on each commit
  - Plot generation tested
  - Reproducibility verified

### Transparent Process

**Benefits**:
- Community can review methods
- Results fully reproducible
- Facilitates review and collaboration
- Supports future assessments

:::
